content: The following lists events that happened during **1984 in Singapore**. ## Incumbents - [President](/wiki/President_of_Singapore): [C. V. Devan Nair](/wiki/C._V._Devan_Nair) - [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore): [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) ## Events ### January - 16 January – The [National Theatre](/wiki/National_Theatre,_Singapore) is closed after being declared structurally unsafe. The Theatre is eventually demolished. - 17 January – The [Singapore Science Park I](/wiki/Singapore_Science_Park#Milestones) is officially opened. The park will be managed by the [Economic Development Board](/wiki/Economic_Development_Board) instead of [Jurong Town Corporation](/wiki/JTC_Corporation). - 20 January – [Liang Court](/wiki/Liang_Court) is officially opened. - 22 January – [Total Defence](/wiki/Total_Defence_(Singapore)) is launched to defend Singapore. Since then, Total Defence Day is commemorated on 15 February every year. ### March - 2 March – The Construction Industry Development Board is formed. - 9 March – [Parkway Parade](/wiki/Parkway_Parade) mall is officially opened. - 15 March – The Punggol Fishing Port and Wholesale Fish Market starts operations, which moved from Kangar market for the construction of [Hougang New Town](/wiki/Hougang_New_Town). ### April - 1 April – [Medisave](/wiki/Medisave) is launched as a personal savings scheme for medical bills. - 17 April – [Changi Airport's](/wiki/Singapore_Changi_Airport) second runway is officially opened to cater for more flights. ### July - 2 July – The Physical Education College is opened, the first college in Singapore specialising in [physical education](/wiki/Physical_education). The institution is later renamed the College of Physical Education (CPE) and merged into the [National Institute of Education](/wiki/National_Institute_of_Education) in 1991. ### August - 4 August – [Singapore Press Holdings](/wiki/Singapore_Press_Holdings) is formed from a merger of four companies, namely Times Publishing Berhad, The Straits Times Press (1975) Limited, Singapore News and Publications Limited and Singapore Newspaper Services Pte Ltd, completed on 30 November. ### September - 1 September – The [Civil Aviation Authority of Singapore](/wiki/Civil_Aviation_Authority_of_Singapore) is formed to manage Singapore's airspace more effectively, replacing the Department of Civil Aviation. ### October - 24 October – The Standard Chartered Bank Building (present day [6 Battery Road](/wiki/6_Battery_Road)) is officially opened. - 31 October – [Creative Technology](/wiki/Creative_Technology) launches a made-in-Singapore computer called the Cubic 99. ### November - November - The [Eat Frozen Pork](/wiki/Eat_Frozen_Pork) is launched to reduce reliance on imports of fresh pork supplies. This comes as the Government moves to phase out pig farms. The campaign did not lead to substantial results. ### December - 1–16 December – Singapore hosts the [Asian Cup 1984](/wiki/Asian_Cup_1984) for the first time, with the tournament ending with a 2–0 finish in favour of [Saudi Arabia](/wiki/Saudi_Arabia_national_football_team) against the [Chinese team](/wiki/China_national_football_team). - 22 December – The PAP wins the [1984 General Election](/wiki/1984_Singapore_general_election) while two members of the opposition parties are elected as members of [parliament](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore). ## Births - 2 February – [Zhang Zhenhuan](/wiki/Zhang_Zhenhuan_(actor)), actor. - 28 April – [Xiaxue](/wiki/Xiaxue), blogger and celebrity. - 19 September – [Gerald Koh](/wiki/Gerald_Koh), radio DJ. - 8 October – [Kendrick Lee](/wiki/Kendrick_Lee_Yen_Hui), national badminton player. - 24 October – [Felicia Chin](/wiki/Felicia_Chin), actress. - 27 December – [Dai Xiangyu](/wiki/Dai_Xiangyu), actor. ## Deaths - 12 March – [L. M. Harrod](/wiki/L._M._Harrod), librarian, director of Raffles Library (b. 1905). - 1 April – Tan Yeok Seong, historian and a collector of books and historical artefacts (b. 1903). - 28 June – [Fok Tai Loy](/wiki/Fok_Tai_Loy), politician, engineer and part-time lecturer (b. 1933). - 29 October – [Lim Koon Teck](/wiki/Lim_Koon_Teck), barrister, industrialist and politician (b. 1904). - 30 November – [Lim Yew Hock](/wiki/Lim_Yew_Hock), 2nd [Chief Minister of Singapore](/wiki/Chief_Minister_of_Singapore) (b. 1914). title: 1984 in Singapore
